title: backport fix: try traverse all unknown parent hash
body: close #2916

title: feat: upgrade hyper and ckb-vm
body: Avoid hyper security issues

title: test(hardfork): refactor and add more testcases for cell deps
body:
The old test specs have `18+18+34+34 = 104` testcases in total.

Current test spec has `4*19*(2*2*2+1) = 684` testcases:
- 4 Chain Status:
  - CKB v2019, far away from the start of v2021.
  - CKB v2019, the last block in v2019 (boundary test).
  - CKB v2021, the first block in v2021(boundary test).
  - CKB v2021, far away from the start of v2021.
- 19 Cell Deps Cases.
  The details can be found in comments.
- 3 Cell Status: where is the cell whose scripts requires the cell deps?
  - The script is in an input cell.
  - The script is in an output cell.
  - No cell requires those cell deps.
- 2 Script Type
  - Lock script.
  - Type script.
- 2 Script Hash Type
  - Data hash-type.
  - Type hash-type.

title: fix: try traverse all unknown parent hash
body: Try traverse all unknown parent hash

backport fix: there may be competition between header sync and eviction
fix: there may be competition between header sync and eviction
body:
relation：#2857

The last PR left a problem. There may be a race condition between the two actions. Before reducing `n_sync_started`, we need to determine whether it is in the `Started` state. 

This PR will backport to 0.43

title: fix: don't panic when the database is created by a higher version executable binary
body:
#### Summary

Backport 1st commit in #2877 to branch "rc/v0.43".

Why no 2nd commit: because there is no fast migrations before "v0.100.0".

#### How to test this feature?
- Build ckb v0.100.0 with the patch #2878.
- Build ckb v0.43.1 with this patch.
- Use patched ckb v0.43.1 to initialize a work directory.
- Run patched ckb v0.100.0 on the previous work directory several minutes.
- Run patched ckb v0.43.1 on the previous work directory to check the error message.
p.s. I did this test in my laptop before pull request.

#### CI Tests

Since CI scripts in old `rc/v*` branches couldn't work, I ran tests in my laptop:
- Rustfmt, clippy, hashes test, wasm test, bench test, unit tests and integration tests are passed.
- Cargo-deny is failed.

title: ci: trigger ci on push specific branches
body:
If we trigger on a branch and later skip the ci workflow, GitHub consider it as passed.

Side effect: forks cannot trigger this workflow other than the specific branches.

title: test(hardfork): test if the B extension feature is correct
body:
### Purpose

At present, there is no tests for B extension.

Limited by the lack of tools, the test coverage for the whole B extension is dependent on `ckb-vm`.

In this PR, only add very simple tests with a very simple B extension instruction [`cpop`](https://github.com/riscv/riscv-bitmanip/blob/1.0.0/bitmanip/_popcount.adoc), to test if the B extension feature is correct:

```
|     Run Script with B-Ext Insts      |
|--------------------------------------|
|         |       |    B-Ext Insts     |
|         |       |---------+----------|
| Edition | Type  |         | Executed |
|         |       | Skipped |----------|
|         |       |         | OK | Err |
|---------+-------|---------+----+-----|
| ckb2019 | Data  |    O    | R  |  R  |
|         | Type  |    O    | R  |  R  |
|---------+-------+---------+----+-----|
|         | Data  |    O    | R  |  R  |
| ckb2021 | Type  |    O    | O  |  X  |
|         | Data1 |    O    | O  |  X  |
```

Description of the table as above:
- Skipped: the script has B extension instructions but not executed.
- Executed: the script has B extension instructions but executed.
  - OK: if all instructions are executed as them defined, the script should be passed.
  - Err: if all instructions are executed as them defined, the script should be failed.
- Result:
  - `O`: Passed.
  - `X`: Failed, the VM returns `ValidationFailure`.
  - `R`: Reject, the VM returns `InvalidInstruction`.

chore(hardfork): bump db migrate version for the new column family of block extension data
body: This PR is useless, unless the PR #2877 was backported to branch "rc/v0.43".

title: fix: don't panic when the database is created by a higher version executable binary
body:
### Commits

- fix: don't panic when the database is created by a higher version executable binary

- fix: the sub-command `run` shouldn't skip the fast migrations

  This bug doesn't affect any old versions because there is no fast migrations in old versions.

  Ref: [What are fast migrations?](https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb/pull/2571#issuecomment-781775665).

title: Workflow for Smoking test suite
body: test result: https://github.com/liya2017/ckb/runs/3131537694?check_suite_focus=true

title: feat: remove old version peer from peer store on fork
body:
1. Remove the behavior of joining the peer store when the session is established, and now only operate the peer store after the identify or feeler is successfully established 
2. After the fork switch, the non-latest version of the node information will be slowly cleaned up, and no longer added to the peer store 
3. Remove unnecessary runtime judgment `RefCell`

title: chore(deps): bump rayon from 1.4.1 to 1.5.1

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [rayon](https://github.com/rayon-rs/rayon) from 1.4.1 to 1.5.1.
Changelog

Sourced from rayon's changelog.

Release rayon 1.5.1 / rayon-core 1.9.1 (2021-05-18)

  • The new in_place_scope and in_place_scope_fifo are variations of scope and scope_fifo, running the initial non-Send callback directly on the current thread, rather than moving execution to the thread pool.
  • With Rust 1.51 or later, arrays now implement IntoParallelIterator.
  • New implementations of FromParallelIterator make it possible to collect complicated nestings of items.
    • FromParallelIterator<(A, B)> for (FromA, FromB) works like unzip.
    • FromParallelIterator<Either<L, R>> for (A, B) works like partition_map.
  • Type inference now works better with parallel Range and RangeInclusive.
  • The implementation of FromParallelIterator and ParallelExtend for Vec<T> now uses MaybeUninit<T> internally to avoid creating any references to uninitialized data.
  • ParallelBridge fixed a bug with threads missing available work.

Contributors

Thanks to all of the contributors for this release!

  • @​atouchet
  • @​cuviper
  • @​Hywan
  • @​iRaiko
  • @​Qwaz
  • @​rocallahan

Release rayon 1.5.0 / rayon-core 1.9.0 (2020-10-21)

  • Update crossbeam dependencies.
  • The minimum supported rustc is now 1.36.

Contributors

Thanks to all of the contributors for this release!

  • @​cuviper
  • @​mbrubeck
  • @​mrksu
Commits

  • 93d9091 Merge #860

  • 87aae49 Merge #859

  • 0bd4ec6 Add in_place_scope_fifo
  • 6a01573 Merge #844
  • 8815e26 Implement in_place_scope: a scope that runs its driver closure on the same th...
  • aacced8 Merge #852
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: feat: add network protocol config
body:
This feature is designed for testing and use of ckb-network crate by third party code, allows user to customize network protocols, for example, only open sync protocol in full node:

```
support_protocols = ["Sync"]
```
